body_html:
@soumith - OK, I understand now, thanks for your help!

To run https://github.com/jcjohnson/neural-style I need torch, not pytorch, and unfortunately there's no easy install via conda.

torch is a separate product from pytorch, pytorch has no depedency on torch.

Well, except from the name, the expectation that pytorch is strongly connected to torch is probably a mistake that new users like me that haven't used either package before are likely to make? So I still think a sentence at http://pytorch.org either in the install or on the about page explicitly stating that one doesn't need http://torch.ch/ would be helpful (especially given their complex install).

body:
@soumith - OK, I understand now, thanks for your help!

To run https://github.com/jcjohnson/neural-style I need torch, not pytorch, and unfortunately there's no easy install via conda.

> torch is a separate product from pytorch, pytorch has no depedency on torch. 

Well, except from the name, the expectation that `pytorch` is strongly connected to `torch` is probably a mistake that new users like me that haven't used either package before are likely to make? So I still think a sentence at http://pytorch.org either in the install or on the about page explicitly stating that one doesn't need http://torch.ch/ would be helpful (especially given their complex install).
